intro: Biscutella raphanifolia var. raphanifolia, commonly known as the garden biscutella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, while the upper leaves are more linear. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. This species is native to southern Europe and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
